unnormalised: So, someone asked me about how the whole college admission thing works in India, especially for engineering. Honestly, it was a roller coaster! After scoring 92% in my 12th boards from Amity International School, I thought I was all set. Little did I know! I prepped for JEE Main like crazy, even joined a coaching class that cost Rs. 2 lakhs. Aiming for IIT Delhi, obviously, but reality hit hard.
normalised: So, someone asked me about how the whole college admission thing works in India, especially for engineering. Honestly, it was a roller coaster! After scoring ninety two percent in my twelfth boards from Amity International School, I thought I was all set. Little did I know! I prepped for J-E-E Main like crazy, even joined a coaching class that cost rupee two lakhs. Aiming for I-I-T Delhi, obviously, but reality hit hard.

unnormalised: JEE Main results came out and I scored a rank of 25,000. Not bad, but not IIT material either. Started looking at other options - private colleges. Manipal Institute of Technology was one, but their fees were like Rs. 4 lakhs per year! Then there's VIT, which takes admissions based on their own exam, VITEEE. My VITEEE rank was decent, around 10,000, which got me into ECE.
normalised: J-E-E Main results came out and I scored a rank of twenty five thousand. Not bad, but not I-I-T material either. Started looking at other options - private colleges. Manipal Institute of Technology was one, but their fees were like rupee four lakhs per year! Then there's V-I-T, which takes admissions based on their own exam, V-I-T-triple-E. My V-I-T-triple-E rank was decent, around ten thousand, which got me into E-C-E.

unnormalised: Ultimately, I decided to go for BITS Pilani. They have their own BITSAT exam. Scored 310/450 in BITSAT, which was enough to get into Computer Science. So, yeah, that's my story. It's not just about marks, it's about strategy, backup plans, and a whole lot of patience! Good luck to everyone prepping!
normalised: Ultimately, I decided to go for B-I-T-S Pilani. They have their own B-I-T-S-A-T exam. Scored three hundred and ten divided by four hundred and fifty in B-I-T-S-A-T, which was enough to get into Computer Science. So, yeah, that's my story. It's not just about marks, it's about strategy, backup plans, and a whole lot of patience! Good luck to everyone prepping!
